ygData.subject: Re: Library help!
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for the continued help.  Building Perl projects is a lot different than this. I ve managed to build Heritrix with the new jars in the project files and

Thanks for the continued help.  Building Perl projects is a lot
different t=
han this.  

I've managed to build Heritrix with the new jars in the projec=
t files
and I get no complaints from my java file about unknown imports.  B=
ut
when I run Heritrix and try to add the new deciderule to a module, I
get=
 a jsp exception page with this: 
-----------
An error occured

java.lang.N=
oClassDefFoundError:
org/apache/xmlrpc/client/XmlRpcClientConfig
----------=
-

XmlRpcClientConfig is a class defined in one of the jars I added to
the =
project.  I have no idea why the project would find the jars
during the com=
pile, but the runtime have no idea where they are.  

I am |-| close to hav=
ing something working, but I've wasted the last 4
hours in vain.  Perhaps y=
ou might also know how to resolve this problem?

Thanks again,
Kaleb 



--=
- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:
>
> =
Kaleb wrote:
> >
> > First, thank you so much for the response. That was a =
ton of help.
> > Just one more question. If I already have the jar files an=
d want to
> > use my local copies, can I just add their location to the
> >=
 project.properties, or do I also need to add them to the
project.xml file?=

> >
> 
> 
> 
> 
> You need to add in both places.  Make sure that the ID i=
n the 
> project.xml dependency section matches the ID suffix in your 
> 'm=
aven.jar.ID' entry in project.properties.
> St.Ack
> 
> 
> >
> > --- In arc=
hive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> > <mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoogroups.com=
>, Michael Stack <stack@> 
> > wrote:
> > >
> > > See the dependencies sect=
ion in the project.xml. If the xmlrpc
lib is
> > > available up in the mave=
n1 ibiblio repository, maven should just
fetch
> > > it for you (You may ne=
ed to add the following to your
> > project.properties
> > > file because H=
eritrix is still stuck on maven 1.0.x:
> > > maven.repo.remote=3Dhttp://rep=
o1.maven.org/maven 
> > <http://repo1.maven.org/maven>).
> > >
> > > Here i=
s some more info on Heritrix and lib jars in case the above
> > proves
> > =
> insufficent. Heritrix goes out of its way to defeat mavens
dependency
> >=
 > fetching mechanism. It does this by setting 'maven.jar.override
=3D on'
=
> > > in project.properties and then mapping project.xml dependency
> > > r=
eferences to actual locations under the lib directory (again in
> > > proje=
ct.properties). The thinking at the time was that the Heritrix
> > > checko=
ut contained all needed to run in the likes of eclipse. Maven
> > was
> > >=
 not required (This will probably change when we move to m2).
> > >
> > > F=
or example, for the libidn jar, in project.xml, it looks like this:
> > >
>=
 > > ...
> > > <dependency>
> > > <id>libidn</id>
> > > <version>0.5.9</ver=
sion>
> > > <url>http://www.gnu.org/software/libidn/ 
> > <http://www.gnu.o=
rg/software/libidn/></url>
> > > <properties>
> > > <war.bundle>true</war.b=
undle>
> > > <ear.bundle>true</ear.bundle>
> > > <ear.bundle.dir>APP-INF/li=
b</ear.bundle.dir>
> > > <description>GNU Libidn is an implementation of th=
e
> > > Stringprep,
> > > Punycode and IDNA specifications defined by the I=
ETF
> > > Internationalized Domain Names (IDN) working group,
> > used for
=
> > > internationalized domain names.
> > > </description>
> > > <license>G=
NU Lesser General Public License
> > > http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.txt=
 
> > <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.txt></license>
> > > </properties>
=
> > > </dependency>
> > > ...
> > >
> > > The 'id' libidn from above is the=
n mapped in project properties
to the
> > > libidn-0.5.9.jar with the follo=
wing project.properties line:
> > >
> > > maven.jar.libidn =3D ${basedir}/l=
ib/libidn-0.5.9.jar
> > >
> > > You might also want to edit .classpath so y=
our new jar shows in
eclipse.
> > >
> > > Hope this helps,
> > > St.Ack
> >=
 >
> > >
> > > Kaleb wrote:
> > > >
> > > > I need to add the Apache XMLRPC=
 jars to the Heritrix build,
but I have
> > > > no idea how to add these to=
 Maven. Could someone point me in the
> > > > right direction or at some pe=
rtinent documents? I've had no
problems
> > > > adding these libs to Netbea=
ns projects, but I don't understand the
> > > > Maven documentation and am =
floundering.
> > > >
> > > > Thanks,
> > > > Kaleb
> > > >
> > > >
> > >
> =
>
> >
>
